com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star

Class StarTopology

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star.DistributedApplicationRegistryProxy
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star.StarTopology
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDistributedApplicationRegistry, IPhysicalTopology

    public class StarTopology
extends DistributedApplicationRegistryProxy
implements IPhysicalTopology
    Uses an IDistributedApplicationRegistry to provide neighbor and reachability information. This is uses in a fully connected network and uses the registry to provide the neighbor and reachability information. All nodes are assumed to be reachable and a neighbor.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getNeighborPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
      Get the list of peer applications that are immediate (one-link) neighbors with the same name space as that of the given app.

      java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
      Get the list of reachable application peers (i.e., having the same name space as that given).

      Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getNeighborPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology

        Specified by:

      • getReachablePeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                      int hops)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.
        Specified by:
        getReachablePeers in interface IPhysicalTopology
        hops - the number of network links to traverse. 0 or larger, where 0 means peers on the same host (i.e. without a hop between NICs).
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.
